title: Confidence interval for proportion owning e-reader

content.question: From a random sample of <math alttext="1,005" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>005</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> adults in the United States, it was found that <math alttext="32" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent own an e-reader. Which of the following is the appropriate <math alttext="90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence interval to estimate the proportion of all adults in the United States who own an e-reader?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.32 plus or minus 1.960 times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 0.32 times 0.68, and denominator the square root of 1,005, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0.32</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.960</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.32</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.68</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>005</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.32 plus or minus 1.645 times, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 0.32 times 0.68, and denominator the square root of 1,005, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0.32</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.645</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.32</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.68</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>005</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.32 plus or minus 2.575 times, the square root of the fraction with numerator 0.32 times 0.68, and denominator 1,005, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0.32</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.575</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.32</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.68</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>005</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.32 plus or minus 1.960 times, the square root of the fraction with numerator 0.32 times 0.68, and denominator 1,005, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0.32</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.960</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.32</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.68</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>005</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.32 plus or minus 1.645 times, the square root of the fraction with numerator 0.32 times 0.68, and denominator 1,005, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0.32</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.645</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.32</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.68</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>005</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.32 plus or minus 1.645 times, the square root of the fraction with numerator 0.32 times 0.68, and denominator 1,005, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0.32</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.645</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.32</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.68</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>005</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
